page.title: 07WORKING AT HIGH HOUSE FARM
page.content: A staff of seven full time workers, four of whom are qualified in agriculture, are employed on the farm. Seasonal workers help out with the harvesting of the barley, wheat and oil seed rape which are the main crops grown. A five year rotation system is used for the crops. Cows and pigs are fattened on the farm. Mr. Taylor has a herd of 120 barley fed beef cattle, mainly Friesians, Herefords and Simmentals. The cattle are bought in from a neighbouring farm at eight weeks old and at seven months old, they are sold in the fatstock market at Bakewell. 450 Large White pigs are also kept on the farm. When they are ready for slaughter at five months old, they are sent to Mansfield.
